bib_record.title: -PRECISE DETERMINATION OF THE BRANCHING RATIO AND Q-VALUE OF THE B-10(N,A) REACTION AND OF THE Q-VALUE OF THE LI-6(N,T) REACTION -.

free_txt: C.B.N.M. GEEL.
FULL REPORT.
PROGRESS REPT, SUPERSEDED.
BR-1 REACTOR, MOL.
GOLD SILICON SURFACE BARRIER DETECTOR, 400 MM2
IN AREA AND 600 OHM.CM RESISTIVITY. THE DETECTOR WAS
OUTSIDE THE DIRECT BEAM BUT PARALLEL TO THE SOURCE.
THE DETECTOR WAS OPERATED AT A REVERSE BIAS OF 20 V,
GIVING A DEPLETION DEPTH OF 55 MICRO-M, SUFFICIENT TO
STOP ALL REACTION PRODUCTS OF B-10(N,A) BUT THIN
ENOUGH TO LIMIT PILE UP OF BACKGROUND PULSES.
BR-1 REACTOR, MOL.
THERMAL NEUTRON BEAM EXTRACTED FROM THE
GRAPHITE REFLECTOR, INTENSITY 10*6 N/CM2/SEC.
CADMIUM RATIO VALUES WERE DETERMINED WITH AND WITHOUT
A 0.4 MM THICK CADMIUM FOIL.
.THERMAL MAXWELLIAN NEUTRON SPECTRUM, WITH
CORRECTION MADE FOR AN EPI-CADMIUM PLUS ROOM
BACKGROUND INTENSITY EQUAL TO 2.80+-0.02 PERCENT
OF THE INCIDENT BEAM.
DETECTION OF EMITTED ALPHAS. GOOD SEPERATION
OF THE TWO ALPHA PEAKS ALLOWS THE SUM OF COUNTS UNDER
EACH PEAK TO BE CONSIDERED PROPORTIONAL TO THE TWO
PARTIAL CROSS SECTIONS TO THE LI-7 GROUND AND FIRST
EXCITED STATES.
.A THIN ELEMENTAL LAYER OF B-10, 15 MICRO-GM/CM2, WITH
A DIAMETER OF 38 MM, PREPARED BY EVAPORATION ON A GOLD
COATED QUARTZ DISK, AND MOUNTED IN A VACUUM CHAMBER A
AT 30 MM FROM THE SENSITIVE SURFACE OF THE DETECTOR.
.VALUE IN TEXT, PAGE 838.

0.free_text: THE BRANCHING RATIO DEFINED AS SIG(N,A(0))/SIG(N,A(1)) GIVEN IN THE TEXT AS PERCENT, BUT CONVERTED HERE INTO AN ABSOLUTE RATIO.

free_txt: .CORRECTED FOR EPITHERMAL NEUTRONS. THE MEASURED
REACTOR SPECTRUM VALUE WAS 6.741+-0.006 PERCENT, AND
THE EPICADMIUM VALUE WAS 7.02+-0.08 PERCENT. WITH
THE MEASURED CADMIUM RATIO OF THE SPECTRUM THE VALUE
FOR EPITHERMAL NEUTRONS AND ROOM BACKGROUND NEUTRONS
IS GIVEN.
THE UNCERTAINTY IS ONE STANDARD DEVIATION,
PRIMARILY FROM STATISTICAL COUNTING UNCERTAINTIES.
THE SUPPLEMENTARY ERROR FROM BACKGROUND WAS AN ORDER
OF MAGNITUDE SMALLER.
.TEXT, PAGE 838.
